name: Philodendron gloriosum
description: Philodendron gloriosum is an epiphytic plant native to the tropical rainforests of Colombia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features creeping stems (30-60 cm long) with large, dramatic, heart-shaped to arrow-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive white to cream venation patterns. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. The name Philodendron means "tree lover" in Greek, referring to its epiphytic growth habit. Many species exhibit dramatic color changes as leaves mature, with new growth often showing vibrant red, pink, or orange hues that fade to green. In its native rainforest habitat, this plant grows in the humid understory with filtered light and high humidity. In its native habitat, it grows on the forest floor or on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive white-veined foliage. It's extremely popular among Philodendron enthusiasts for its attractive venation.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
